io.bretty.console.view

Class AbstractView

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.bretty.console.view.AbstractView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionView, MenuView

    public abstract class AbstractView
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_ERROR_MESSAGE 
      protected java.lang.String inputErrorMessage
      The message to display when the user inputs an invalid value
      protected java.util.Scanner keyboard
      the Scanner to handle user command line input
      protected java.lang.String nameInParentMenu
      the name of this view when displayed in a parent MenuView
      protected AbstractView parentView
      the parent view of the current view if the current view is the root view, this field will always be null
      protected java.lang.String runningTitle
      the string always to be displayed in the first line whenever this view is running

      • read

        protected <T> T read(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass)
        Read an object from command line user input
        Type Parameters:
        T - Expected class
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print asking for user's input
        expectedClass - The expected class of user input
        Returns:
        the scanned input of the expected type

      • read

        protected <T> T read(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass,
                     Validator<T> validator)
        Read an object from command line user input
        Type Parameters:
        T - Expected class
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print asking for user's input
        expectedClass - The class of the expected data scanned (e.g. Integer.class). Currently all expected classes as in the .nextInt(), .nextDouble() etc. are supported. Aka when you create a Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);, all the next...() methods you will invoke on the keyboard object can be replaced by this method
        validator - A custom validator to validate the user input
        Returns:
        the scanned input of the expected type
